< Review>
As someone who WORKS in the Hollywood and Highland, I gotta say, this is one of my favorite places to eat. Not sure where some of these bad reviews came from, but I assure everyone it‚Äôs one of the only places close by that actually makes FRESH food. As someone who cooks for his family at home, that means a lot to me. Especially with Mexican food, if you try to rush things as simple as beans or rice, they will come out uncooked and hard. This place has been 100% consistent with all of my orders. The salsas on the side are delicious! Their food is Creative! Got my co worker addicted recently üòä Great job guys! You deserve a lot of success!<//Review>

< Review>
I've been here a few times and always enjoy the food. The salsa is pretty epic, Iin fact. Last time I was there the guy who took my order was great and happily let me have a special order of something that wasn't exactly on the menu (but they had all of the ingredients for). He was really friendly and seemed to enjoy giving good service. Today was a different story. The lady that took my order absolutely refused to modify my order. I couldn't even get a scoop of guacamole on the side, even if I paid extra for it. No, I would have to get a big tub for $5. I really should have left since there is no shortage of good Mexican food on this street. Honestly, I just stopped since I needed a break from driving (Santa Barbara to Santa Monica). She really wasn't nice at all. I doubt I'll ever go back, you can literally walk to other good food in the area from here. Maybe it's harsh but I'm more selective these days with who gets my money.<//Review>

<user_id>104177078480885682897</user_id><user_name>Alfred Velasquez Sr</user_name>< Time>
1555037130705< /Time>
< rating>
5< /rating>
< Review>
IN THE MID 1950'S THIS RESTAURANT WAS KNOWN AS ROLLY'S  RESTAURANT AND IT WAS LOCATED AT THE CORNER OF OXNARD BLVD AND FORTH STREET. IT PRIMARILY SERVED AMERICAN DISHES, OVER TIME THIS RESTAURANT HAS BEEN CONVERTED INTO A MEXICAN RESTAURANT. THE INSIDE OF THE RESTAURANT IS ALWAYS VERY CLEAN INSIDE AND OUT SIDE. THE OWNER RENE WAS A COOK AT THE WELL KNOWN CIELITO LINDO RESTAURANT FOR YEARS  LOCATED ON OXNARD BLVD. COUNTRY, SUPER STAR SINGER WILLIE NELSON AND OTHER CELEBRITIES ENJOY RENE'S CHILI RELLENOS AND GROUND BEEF ENCHILADAS. DURING THEIR  VISIT TO OXNARD  WHILE THEY RECORDED  WILLIE NELSON CD AT THE OLD MOVIE THEATER ON OXNARD BLVD BETWEEN  6th AND 7th STREET, AFTER DECADES OF  OWNING BAHIA RESTAURANT, RENE STILL SERVES THE INCREDIBLY CHILI RELLENOS AND BEEF ENCHILADAS AND OTHER GREAT DISHES. ONCE YOU TRY RENE'S CHILI RELLENOS AND ENCHILADAS I AM SURE YOU WILL BE BACK.
P.S, IN 1954 I WAS 10 YEARS OLD AND I WOULD WALK INTO ROLLY'S RESTAURANT DAILY TO SELL THE OXNARD PRESS COURIER NEWS PAPER TO CUSTOMERS FOR A NICKEL. THOSE WERE THE GOOD OLD DAYS GROWING UP IN OXNARD " THE PRESS COURIER'S PRINTING DEPARTMENT
WAS ACROSS THE ALLEY NEXT TO THE POST OFFICE ON 4th AND C ST.
AL VELASQUEZ SR</Review>

Came here for dinner one evening.  Not crowded.  Ordered the Caldo de siete mares which was wonderful! <text>One of the Best Thai Temples in SF bay area,
They have english speakers available and have English Buddhist books for free should you want to know more or study about buddhism.

On top of welcoming ALL visitors you can come every sunday to buy authentic Thai food and sit and visit or pick up some to take home.

Everyone is friendly and you will leave with a smile on your face once  you visit with the people, from the Land Of Smiles.<//text></record></dataset><record>

<text>Go Staff Go Away.

The most horribly run family business. They think they are the mafia of the industry. They'll spy on you, and do anything they can to prevent you from hiring individuals at full time and better pay. So many I've meet that are hungry and can't get enough work from them, and they are threatened  never to be used again if they seek additional employment from there competitors or take full time work from the temp job. Why would any human being deprive people with family some relief they can come home and feed them. Brooke, you and your family are the most disgusting and greed ridden company I've ever known. Also, they force the employing company to sign into a contract the day they bring the employees without prior knowledge. Let's not even talk about the pay such a greed ridden company, they pay the minimum wage while the average job pays 30-30% more. The most disgusting family run business I'm aware of. Brooke, the daughter of the owner is an absolutely Cockroach. Do yourself a favor, go elsewhere, and by the way, Im told from there former employees, (the ones that have worked for me) if the don't give them a favorable review, they won't place them. If I can give below a star, I'd gladly do so.

<review>staff is awesome, but this place is a joke.

the chart stipulating what you owe them at the end of the year according to what your hourly pay is was pretty special.

not being told what the business model is and how it works is pretty special. check out the first line of their I-9. it's the last onslaught of computer interaction they put you through (office skills testing, some critical thinking assessment, and finally their "paperwork"), and you tell me if anything was "offered" to you.

next issue was agreeing to adhere to their employee handbook regulations and whatnot...only there were never any terms to read.

having an agreement in which one gives up their filming (and using likeness of) consent is special, too.

< Review>
Go-Staff did exactly what I couldn't do, found me a job. I applied on a Friday and received an interview right away the following Tuesday. Noelle was the girl I interviewed with. After my interview she recommended I fill out my W-2 with them so I would already have that done in case a job I would be a good fit with came up. Before I was even done filling them out she informed me of a position I was a good fit for and asked me if I could start Monday! She found me a job in less than a week after I had been searching for 9 months. I was a temp at the company for 4 months and they liked me enough they hired me on permanently. If you tell them what you want, they will find it for you. It's because of Go-Staff I have a job and I will always recommend them to anyone I know looking for work.< /Review>

Got another phone interview rescheduled for the same day at 5pm, this time on his cell.

Called Glenn at 5pm on his cell.  It went straight to voicemail.  I left another message & informed Go-Staff.  They made excuses for Glenn at Prava & for themselves.

At this point, I requested that if Glenn wanted to interview me, he can call.  Go-Staff agreed but still pushed for me to keep calling him for a phone interview.

So let me get this straight ... according to Go-Staff, Glenn called them after each failed attempt of mine to connect but he couldn't call me himself??  Is this weird, yet unprofessional, business practice on both Prava Construction & Go-Staff or is it just me?

It's the following day & I still have not received an update on what happened & status of the phone interview nor why Glenn, the owner of Prava Construction (Go-Staff's long-term client) didn't pick up nor call me back.

This is the first time I've applied to any of their jobs & it was a very poor, weird, unprofessional experience.  I value my time as a job-seeker & Prava Construction should, as well.

Above all, Go-Staff needs to show their job-seeking clients more respect. My personal favorite is their chamarindo ice cream made with chamoy and tamarindo. In addition they offer more then just ice cream. They offer traditional style Mexican fruit cups and popsicles.

At the time of going there it was $3 for a scoop but they heap that cup full to the brim.</text><Response>None</Response><rate>5< /rate><date>1549225144094<//date>< username>

Delicious ice cream made in house, lots of variety in both classics like chocolate, strawberry, etc, and less common flavors like tequila, horchata, Mexican chocolate, etc.

<UserId.>118288057641342318189< /UserId.>< username>
Heather Tidrick<//username>
<date>1505361141530< /date><Rate>2</Rate>< Review>
I wish there were a way in providing a rating to differentiate between the specific staff at a location of a corporation and the corporation itself. The people at this specific store are very friendly, helpful, and accommodating. The storage space for U-boxes as well as the retail space are clean and adequate. The basic U-Haul equipment provided by them, including packing materials and vehicles, is satisfactory and nicely varied. But if you ever want to get them on the phone, forget it. The location on Santa Rosa Ave is also in a neighborhood where you have to be mindful of the possibility of theft, which complicates accessing anything in storage there. (Staff discourage you from leaving anything in your car, and are rightfully disinclined to leave U-boxes out in the yard for easier access. .. and since you can't reach them by phone to negotiate timing, it's complicated.)

But most of all, if I could give negative stars for the customer service provided by U-Haul as a company, I would. If you're looking for a moving solution, save yourself a whole slew of headaches, hassle, and misinformation, and go elsewhere.</Review>

I left my tie downs in the trailer the day before and had gone back the next day to get them and it was back in its original rental spot but still got the call 3 days later I hadn't returned it. Not sure what the check in and out process is here but sounds like it could use a little double checking in.< /Review>

<user>108572609999703528890</user><Name>G Blair<//Name><date>1570139119824</date><Rate>5<//Rate>< text>
As a lifetime sugar addict, I have made countless visits to many dentists from Newport Beach to Los Angeles for more than 50 years. Sherman Oaks Dentistry and Dr. Perlaza gave me exceptional first impressions (no pun intended). The receptionist, office manager, and dental assistant were all extremely courteous, friendly and fabulously efficient. We all know the support staff is just as important as the dentist since a badly run office can be maddening when they mix up your appointment or files or keep you waiting for 45 minutes or send you a surprise bill for hundreds of dollars. The great office staff had my costs ready by the time I asked since they checked my insurance right after I made my appointment. Dental costs are another huge concern for all of us today. I had xrays, photos and an exam for a $21.80 co-pay...from a PPO cosmetic/implant/general dentist in Sherman Oaks!!! I asked Dr. Perlaza to check a bonding problem from a previous cosmetic dentist. He not only listened, he did exactly what I requested. The staff had my estimate before I asked: a co-pay of $50.80 out of a $254 cost. The last two or three dentists I went to with only one problem didn't bother listening to why I was there and gave me estimates for anything they could think of up to a total of $3,000 (exactly double what my insurance would cover since they knew my co-pay was 50% then). Shocking dental cost estimates have been the topic of many lunches with former co-workers and now co-retirees who are all just trying to make ends meet. One co-worker with a wife and 3 kids who answered a "free exam and xrays" coupon got a "family deal" estimate for $10,000!!! Seriously! Most dentists today not only have DDS after their names, they also have the big $$$ items "cosmetic dentistry and implants" listed after their names. Which brings me to the most important member of the team, Dr. Perlaza. He also has "general dentistry" after his name. He is the real deal! After listening to all my other concerns, he examined all my teeth, xrays  and photos. He clearly explained everything in detail (he teaches at UCLA) without being condescending. He tactfully explained why "a Hollywood Smile with veneers" would be a waste of money for me since I have severe problems with receeding bone and gums which will just get worse with age. He did not try to sell me anything like the last three dentists. More importantly, he took the time to answer all my questions and discuss options. He also suggested I Google some options without someone trying to sell me anything. However, the coolest thing is he is a scuba diver who does underwater photography. While you are getting a dental procedure you won't even think about it.....since you can watch a video of him deep in the ocean in a shark cage surrounded by sharks. Dr. Perlaza is the one with the camera,  NOT one of the blood thirsty sharks (pun intended). I think I need to refer my former co-worker with the 3 kids to him. They need a real dentist like Dr Perlaza. So do I for the next 30 years.</text>

<Review>I went to see Dr. Perlaza for a fifth opinion regarding a dental issue I was having. I was told I had horrible gum recession and needed gum grafting. Mark Henderson<//name>
< Time>
1474300123552<//Time>
< rating>
5<//rating>
< review>
15 years ago, when my wife was a patient of Dr. Perlaza and I wasn't, I had excruciating tooth pain on a Sunday. Dr. Perlaza, on his day off, agreed to meet me at his office to perform an emergency root canal. Suffice it to say that I was extremely grateful for the courtesy and became a loyal patient.

Over the years, Dr. Perlaza continued to prove that he is an excellent dentist. He runs his practice with great efficiency. His advice and recommendations are always honest and not embellished. I love his office's set up which is state of the art and soothing. For any procedure, there is a TV screen overhead. For longer procedures, there is a menu of films to watch. Fortunately (or unfortunately) I once got to see one of those films from beginning to end, which kept my mind occupied. :)

The most important thing is that Dr. Perlaza has a soft touch with everything he does. Even the anesthesia shots don't hurt! After getting to know Dr. Perlaza's soft touch, I was never apprehensive again about going to him for any scheduled procedure and I always trusted that I would walk out of his office painlessly.

I moved out of the area a couple of months ago and doubt I will ever find another dentist of Dr. Perlaza's caliber. Too bad, so sad.< /review>
<Pictures>None</Pictures>< Response>
None<//Response>

<UserId.>102270052550478286473< /UserId.><name>Jim Thommes<//name><time>1618615613088<//time><rate>4<//rate><text>We had a leak in the upstairs  shower drain pipe that left water puddles in the downstairs kitchen. The Bill Howe Technician was excellent! He came out twice to help find the leak. All initial estimates and advice were no charge.

When it came to making the repair, the Plumbing technician came on time and did a great job - very professionally done! He explained what he was doing and why along the way during the repair and came in under the estimate.

There would be 5 stars given the quality of work, friendliness, and professionalism of the plumbing technician. However, I gave 4 stars because the Bill Howe price estimating and billing process is somewhat opaque. You get a total price estimate and number of hours expected to be charged - nothing for materials, just a total price. When the job was completed an hour under the hours estimate, the price came to only $100 less than the  estimate - and still no materials itemization on the price.

I think the price was mostly fair as near as I can tell given the up front work not charged. I would use Bill Howe again no doubt. But next time, I will ask for a better explanation of the estimate and the final price.</text>< pictures>

<gmap_id>0x80dbffd6a74d24ed:0xd95f60f86694dfb9</gmap_id><Pics>None<//Pics><time>1617900979101</time><Resp>{'time': 1617926084429, 'text': 'Sorry you feel that way, Adriana.  In fact we did give you a detailed estimate that you approved - full content of that below.  Also, after letting you know that there was going to be drywall intrusion, we quoted the cost of repair from our restoration department. You declined that, which was certainly your prerogative, but we did let you know.  We feel we did very good work for the scope required, which was beyond the need to simply re-pipe the water heater.\n\nEstimate provided:\nBill Howe Plumbing Heating and and Air Conditioning, Inc. (BHP) will provide labor, equipment and materials to reroute two copper hot water lines, eliminating the subterranean hot water line affected by a slab leak. The new line will start at the water heater and making the first connection to the line located on the south area of garage east wall and connecting the second line to the north area of the garage east wall. Technician will run new water lines exposed through garage area properly insulated and strapped to the outside portion of the walls. BHP will open all necessary access points in walls and ceilings to install new water lines. BHP will use type L copper pipe. All connections will be lead free soldered. If house was built before 1985, prior to commencing work customer will provide proof of certification that there is no asbestos in the areas that need to be opened to install new water line or owner and all tenants will sign the pre-existing conditions liability release form.\n\nThis bid does not include any cosmetic repair work.(drywall, wood, etc)\n\nThis job will take approximately 1 day to complete and will carry a 3 year labor and a 10 year material warranty.\n\nRe-route cost $2530.00-$245.00 leak detection credit\nTotal is $2285.00\n\nBHP will need to expose manifolds before providing final estimate.\n\nNOTE: BHP is not responsible for lead or asbestos testing that may be required prior to start of the job (property built previous to 1985), or for the removal of any materials that are positive for lead or asbestos.\nNOTE: BHP is not responsible for any unforeseen circumstances or objects that may delay the job. In the event that any occur, a change order and a new contract price will be provided. BHP is also not responsible for any landscaping, carpet, tile, wall or floor repair, concrete or stucco repair or replacement. All work will comply with the Uniform Plumbing Code and will be within the standards of trade.\nSubtotal\t$2,285.00\tTax\t$0.00\nTotal\t$2,285.00\tBalance\t$0.00'}< /Resp><review>They sent me an estimate for re piping a garage water heater. < review>
In the middle of a world wide pandemic Bill Howe and all of the wonderful service technicians, office staff from plumbers to reconstruction teams were so helpful.
My 87 year old parents hot water heater blew out causing a flood and drywall damage to their garage. I called Bill Howe and they sent a plumber out the same day to remove the old hot water heater and set up a temporary hot water heater. They took my worries away about my parents going without hot water and dealing with a flooded garage.

<Text>Our water heater went out the weekend before Christmas 2019. We called several plumbing companies for quotes and they all seemed pretty high. So, we decided to call Bill Howe and they were very reasonable; they came out on Monday, which was the same day we called them. They gave me a estimated quote over the phone. <Text>Owing a historic home is always an adventure. Our 1928 gas furnace was turned off for termite fumigation and because the crawl space is minimal we needed a professional to get it up and running. I called Bill Howe Plumbing and got an appointment that week. Dan and came out and bravely squeezed under the house. After inspecting the furnace, he determined that we had a small leak in one of the lines and needed to replace a valve. He put the valve on order. I got a call when the part was in and was able to schedule for the next day. Dan came back, replaced the valve, and got the furnace relit and functioning. We also needed a water line installed for our refrigerator. He was able to use an existing cold water line from our sink and plumb it under the house and across the kitchen to the refrigerator. His work was meticulous and careful, as it required drilling into the floor and under sink cabinet. < Review>
The water heater in my mother-in-laws house started to leak after only 4 years in service. I checked the installation of the old one and found it to be very shoddy. It sits outside in a dedicated closet. The installation details were not filled out, it was not in a pan but sitting on the cement floor. The connections were not really that secure. I shut it all down, and told her to call Bill Howe. They came out last year and fixed a clogged main line with great efficiency.

She told me it was installed, so I went over to check it out. The installation was very good. It is now centered in the closet, sitting in a non-rust pan raised off the ground, all the paperwork is accessible, the details are filled out on the stickers, the plumbing and gas lines are new and properly routed. Just an outstanding job and great attention to detail all around.
They are local and care about what they do, more so than other plumbers and pipe-fitters I have dealt with. The team is knowledgeable and friendly. If they don't know, they ask! Parts are stocked in the truck so delays are not an issue.
If you need any plumbing work done, give Bill Howe a call. The right price, the right parts, the best team!
Thank you!< /Review>

<user_name>Devils<//user_name>< Review>
I had a hot water pipe break under the slab of my house. Yikes! I called Bill Howe and the response was cool and collected but also had a sense of urgency to come help me.
The technician/ plumber arrived 5 minutes early, was clean, courteous and, yes, had a sense of urgency to stop firther damage fast.
The technician detected the location of the leak very fast using high end equipment and provided several options to fix the piping and the pros and cons of each.
His work was swift but of high quality. Clean welds, clean cuts in the drywall (which make it easier to repair) and vacuumed up after himself.
Also along the way when damage was found to other pipes he showed photos of what he found and even tightened a loose fitting in the attic when he observed an unsafe condition with a pipe.
Once the work was complete the tech explained everything he did and he left the house cleaner than he found it. He left no evidence of dust or work having been done.
Bottom line, Bill Howe and their technicians have mastered the work they do and I will call them again for any future plumbing issues.</Review>

<rate>5</rate>< review>
The plumbers arrived precisely on time at 8:00 AM to install a new water line from the street to the house since the original was leaking badly.  The work was done in a highly prompt and efficient manner.  I really appreciate the "leave it as you found it attitude" of the team that did the work.  They sodded the trench before it was dug and the sod was placed back when done. The trench dirt was placed on plastic so it could all be returned to the trench not leaving any on the lawn.  Also even though the what the plumbers and I thought were tiles unexpectedly turned out to be 4 1/2 inch concrete the team took on the extra effort without complaint and did not charge extra.  Again with "leave it as you found it" care was taken when cutting the concrete to cut in the "grout lines" of the tiles on top and it was able to be placed back as is was without damage.  All the fine details we agreed on were like the new shutoff valve to the irrigation system were done without having to remind or nag them.   Today I did a leak test on the system, when I left for work the water meter read  73738.76 when I returned it read 73738.76. This shows the work was done right the first time.

I really appreciate the hard and excellent work the team did and it really exceeded my expectations.  I would use this team again for future work.< /review>

<Text>ok, one experience, so that's all I can speak to, that being said...had a leaking copper pipe joint under the house. Tried to fix myself but crawl space was EXTREMELY  small (not enough to turn or roll over, just inch along on back). Pipe was right up against a board, so you couldn't really get to it on all sides. Technician (Gustavo) showed up on time, listened to what I had ,and what I had tried, and then spent the next two hours in that crawl space (did I mention it was basically all  mud from the leak?) and fixed it in one shot! < Review>
Initially I called because of a leak under the kitchen sink which turned out to be a loose connection on the faucet. I talked to Tony about a  drain problem. Alex came out to ensure the problem and get a Plumbing Tech out to resolve the problem. The piping was complicated as there was not 1 hot and 1 cold pipe, but 2 cold & 1 hot. The cold pipes each branched off with 1/2" pipes. So I opened the walls on both ends according to CPL.

< rating>
5< /rating>
<text>We have used Bill Howe Plumbing for many years anytime we have an emergency plumbing issue, because we trust this company to respond quickly in sending out reliable employees and will give us an accurate diagnosis. Bill Howe Plumbing is the only company we call for help.

Our upstairs bathroom toilet flooded, causing water to flood down onto our kitchen ceiling, causing water damage in both rooms. Within an hour of calling Bill Howe, Carlos Paredes, EMS Lead Technician arrived to assess the flood damage. He quickly found the source of the flood and presented us with a clear water damage remediation plan. We had met Carlos earlier this year when our water heater flooded our laundry room and he was sent out to evaluate the water damage. We knew we were in good hands again when Carlos arrived for this emergency, because we knew him to be trustworthy, he communicated each step of the process clearly in a way for us to know exactly how the damage was going to be fixed and made us feel we were right in calling Bill Howe.

That first day, Carlos began by placing dehumidifiers in our bathroom and in our kitchen to start getting the moisture damage to dry. He explained each step in the plan ‚Äì cleaning, drying, sanitizing, repairing structural damage and finally, restoration. Carlos then gave us a window of time when he would be returning the next day.

The second day, Fernando M. came with Carlos to begin the water damage remediation process. They called before they arrived to let us know they were on their way and were on time at the beginning of the arrival window. Both men worked very hard in cleaning up both damaged areas to prepare for the encased drying plastic sheeting that would house the dehumidifiers and heat blowers in each room. Fernando first put down carpet and tile protection sheeting to keep our floors safe from all the water damaged debris that was going to be removed. Both men made sure that all areas of the house were protected before the remediation process began. The machines they used were cutting edge equipment for drying and cleaning. When they were done, everything was cleaned up, sanitized and safely secured to begin the next step of drying. Carlos explained that they would be back the next day to take moisture readings from both rooms and to make sure that the machines were working well.

The following day, Carlos and Fernando were on time and quickly checked all readings from the machines. They decided that the drying process could be helped by removing the subflooring from the bathroom, opening more air space for the heat blowers and dehydrators to work more efficiently. After 24 hours, they returned and the drying process was almost complete.

The next step after the initial remediation is completed will be the restoration. Bill Howe will be sending out another team for the restoration. We would like to sincerely thank Carlos and Fernando for their dedicated work ethic, professionalism and great sense of humor. It has been a pleasure working with them and we hope if we need to call Bill Howe in the future, that they are sent out to our home again.</text><pictures>None< /pictures>< Resp>

<GmapID>0x80dbffd6a74d24ed:0xd95f60f86694dfb9</GmapID><user_name>Judith Whitmer<//user_name>< review>
My house is in the Serra Mesa and recently I heard of some instances of house pipes collapsing in the area.  A plumber who was doing some of the work on one of the effected homes told me that the homeowner was paying $23,000 to fix the problem.  The plumber not employed by the Bill Howe Co. referred to me to that company as being  reasonable and reliable.
I followed the suggestion and enjoyed great personal service by all staff.  Eric explained to me what was involved in the inspection, cleaning and lining of my cleanout pipe.  They took a video of my pipe to see what shape it was in, showed it to me explaining what the video revealed (3 holes and some cracks.)  Gave me a fair price for the cleaning and repair by lining of the damaged sections.  The cleaning took a day and the lining of the pipe a couple days.
I highly recommend them to any one who needs plumbing work done.< /review>

John showed up 20 minutes late from my scheduled time and I thought he would be even later after that heads up phone call. I live in a Townhouse and the water supply ball valve is very old and is not a 100% shutoff valve anymore. We shut the water off at the valve and at my hot water heater. The ball valve going to my hot water heater broke as he was turning it on. He changed that out also.

115028035376789176307<//user>
<user_name>Helen Sabo< /user_name><Date>1498449568265</Date><Rating>5<//Rating>< Review>
We had a tree root clogging our sewer line, at a spot underneath our driveway. Two other plumbing companies offered to dig up the pipes and replace the clogged pipes, at considerable expense. Bill Howe Plumbing offered to clear the pipes and install an epoxy seal, without ripping up our driveway, for about 1/2 the cost, and agreed that if for some reason, the epoxy seal couldn't be done, they would match the cheapest bid we had from their competitors. The epoxy seal worked great, saving us almost $2000 in repair costs. The workers came when they said they would be here, and were very courteous and professional, and we were able to see from video that they took that the line is clear and now protected from further intrusions.<//Review>

<user>104865594721898763696< /user>< name>
Morgan A.</name>
< time>
1531404120497</time>
< Rate>
1</Rate>
< Review>
I called and made an appointment and told the dispatcher exactly what I needed (5 angle valves replaced). The appointment window was set for 2-5 pm and the technician shows up at 4 pm. I can immediately tell he does not want to do the work because it is 4 pm. He tries to dissuade me by telling me that after 5 pm it is overtime charges, its late the neighbors will come home etc. I insisted that the water shut off was for that time period and wanted to continue with the work. He then goes to his truck and conveniently he "does not have all the parts"....even though I was very specific when I made the appointment. Complete waste of time. I found a local small business to come by the next day and take care of it.</Review>

<Rating>5</Rating>< Review>
We have used Bill Howe on a couple of occasions and would highly recommend them. Overall, they provide excellent service, take time to explain the issue and are so courteous and professional.

The first time we needed a plumber was when our upstairs bathroom plumbing in our first home began leaking into our downstairs. After contacting 2 other local plumbers who tore a HUGE hole in our ceiling and charged us hundreds of dollars without even successfully repairing the issue we were fed up and were looking for someone who would guarantee their work. So... we contacted Bill Howe!

Bill Howe was able to come right away and they actually had all of the parts with them which was so nice since the previous plumbers had to keep leaving to get different parts. Plus, the plumber form Bill Howe was so nice and explained everything he was doing and actually left us with guarantee/warranty on the job so that if we had any other issues we could easily call them back out free of charge.

We actually never needed the warranty though because they completely resolved the problem in just one visit. We still own this property and the repair they initially made 3 years ago is still holding.

Now that we are in our second home, we contacted them a couple months ago when our kitchen sink began leaking. Once again, they sent someone right away who was also super nice and explained everything he was doing. Literally, within 10-15 mins our sink was like new and the plumber cleaned up after himself.

We've had such a great experience with Bill Howe that we honestly wouldn't even consider another company for our plumbing needs. They are fast, efficient and so nice to work with!< /Review>

<Time>1504225146545</Time><Rate>5< /Rate>< text>
It's great to know that in the modern-day race to the bottom there are still honest, reliable and professional companies (and technicians). We have Old Republic Home Protection policy and when our AC unit failed (in the middle of July heat) we had Old Republic send out 4 different technicians to fix our unit. All of them said the system was "too complicated" and they didn't know what was wrong. I finally did a little bit of my own research and found Bill Howe. The reviews were fantastic, but having already dealt with four different technicians I was skeptical. Bill Howe sent out a technician for a free (yes, free) diagnostic. Mike Reif (the technician) was on time, professional, polite, courteous, and figured out the problem in less than 2 hours. I was shocked. Having now had experience with Bill Howe (and Mike Reif specifically), they will always be the first people I call, and the first people I will recommend to friends and family,  with any heating or cooling issue. These guys know what they are doing and will patiently explain everything to you without trying to gouge you on the price. Definitely a five-star experience.< /text>

I can‚Äôt say enough kind things about the people who work here. Everyone I spoke to was pleasant, knowledgeable, and helpful. Dashawn, who was asssigned to come out, is an excellent technician and human being. I had a slow leak at the base of my toilet, so he came out to replace the wax ring. He was very respectful of my home. He immediately noticed that we leave our shoes in the entryway and made sure he had protective boot covers. He also had some interesting tips on how to keep kitchen pipes unclogged, which I am looking forward to putting into use.

As Dashawn was getting ready to lift up the toilet to replace the wax ring, he discovered a leak from a corroded connection and fixed that. After several tests, it appeared that this had actually been the source. It seemed like the   fixed  problem without needing to address a more intensive wax ring issue.

About eight hours later, I discovered to my distress that while the connection was the main source of the problem, the wax ring had also been leaking at a very slow rate. I left a message with the after hours dispatchers, spoke with the emergency tech, and they left excellent information for the day dispatcher, as we all agreed that didn‚Äôt require someone to be out at 10:00 at night.

The next day, Dashawn took it upon himself to talk to his manager, explain the situation, and arrange for me to only pay the materials fees for the second visit before calling me. He was extremely sorry that he was unable to catch a hint of the secondary issue, though it took a very long time for it to develop. It manifested so subtly that I would not have noticed it until the next day if I hadn‚Äôt been on hyper alert from the earlier trouble.

He took the time to figure out how issues specific to my bathroom might have masked the secondary problem and addressed them. I couldn‚Äôt be more grateful.

I completely and wholeheartedly recommend Dashawn and Bill Howe plumbing.</text>

He proceeded to snake the drain, write up my invoice, accept my payment and leave, only for me to find out an hour later that he didn't do his job and the clog came back. After speaking with their customer service rep (these women are amazing), a technician was scheduled to come out at 830 pm (an hour after I close), but I waited. < Name>
Linda Steenson< /Name>
<Pictures>None< /Pictures>< Text>
I had a sewer lateral break open 90 year old cast iron line I was going for major surgery in one week and needed to do something fast.  Although I normally get bids for a big job like this (the concrete in the city's right of way needed to be opened, requiring four different permits), I simply didn't have time.

Bill HOWE is a large company with the licenses, knowledge and resources to marshal together the companies required to do this job (traffic signage and barricade), shoring (steel plates), excavation and restoration, concrete, and, of course, plumbing.

I worked with Hector and Jesus and they were, at all times, professional. The job was done exactly on the dates that they indicated and all city inspections were approved without a hitch.
I had the line on my property (my rental unit) back up twice during this time (not related to the break) and they stepped in and took care of these problems quickly (one clearing was done at 10:30 pm)

Although I cannot speak to the competitiveness of their price, they took care of me when I needed it most.  I would highly recommend them.< /Text>

<text>On Sunday afternoon, a toilet, sink and tub suddenly wouldn't drain but the nearby fixtures, closer to the street, were okay, so we knew we had a clog.  Plunging was ineffective, since it just sloshed the collected water back and forth.

When I knew I'd need a professional, my first call was to the number for Bill Howe.  The operator said the plumber would call, which he soon did.  Jesus told me where he was and estimated the cost, based on what I told him about the problem.  He arrived ahead of schedule and used a power snake through a roof vent and reached the clog in a few minutes of carefully easing the snake into the drain.  (old house wants to be treated gently.)

He inspected under the house to make sure that the pipes were still in good shape (Yes) and packed up..  The final price matched his original estimate, minus a few bucks for the Senior Discount;  thank you very much for that.

This is not the first time we've had Bill Howe rescue us.  They'll be the first call, again, next time we get in a jam.< /text><pictures>None< /pictures>< gmapID>

stewart austin</Name>
<Review>Be careful of 5 star reviews...  I have used Bill Howe for many years.  Always professional and fair price -- job done properly/to my satisfaction.

This time around I was traveling, my wife called another company for a plumbing repair, my fault for not letting her know about Bill Howe.  My wife is smart enough to use Yelp reviews, found a company (Courtesy) with 5 star rating, came to my home and fixed the problem, professional, nice guys -- challenge (problem/issue) was their pricing for materials, appeared to be VERY high.  But it was a situation that i had to fix immediately because water was leaking from my main line outside my home.

While at my home (via phone) I asked Courtesy to check a second problem, a leaking gas pipe feed to my pool, they came back to my home today, once again very nice guys, professional, dug around the pipe to expose to find the leak, could not find, recommended i get a leak detection specialist -- which is ok.  The challenge was the price for materials quoted, just way too high (given my experience remodeling many/multiple homes).

I thereafter called Bill Howe Plumbing, Jessica (Howe) answered, asked me to email a picture of the job so they assess -- a 5' feed from the flex to the meter.  I emailed the picture, followed up with Jessica, and to my amazement 15 minutes later I got a call from Bill Howe himself.  I explained the situaiton, Bill was extremely patient and professional, I asked him what he would charge for similar materials.  He explained materials (a 90 degree transition sweep) could be a different brand from Courtesy, but his price for the materials would be 'no more than $250...' (vs. $500+ for Courtesy).

I was a bit curious so I called a couple of plumbing supply stores, received a price of $175-190 over the phone, each store confirmed a contractor/plumber would get a discounted price.  So at the end of the day, Courtesy was charging a 400% mark-up for materials.  Great (nice) guys who get fantastic yelp reviews, make like they're your honest buddy, but really 'stick it' to us with overinflated material costs, and hopefully you'll all now know better -- Bill really 'knows how'...  And be very careful when you read 5 star reviews...<//Review>< Date>

< text>
We recently had issues with our HVAC and on the recommendation of both a neighbor and co-worker decided to call Bill Howe. We were very skeptical and concerned about getting "ripped off" to put it mildly after several bad and costly experiences with other larger and supposed reputable companies.

Boy, where we ever surprised!! The technician who serviced our unit was nothing short of fantastic, professional and honest which is hard to come by in this industry I have learned. I did not feel for a second we were being taken advantage of or that he was in any way trying to "up-sell" us, there was no panic mode and he spoke to us not like we were dummies but rather explained everything so that we were able to make an informed decision on our mess of an HVAC unit.

I would highly recommend this company, not just because they are local and its always good to support the local businesses but because honesty and professionalism is pretty darn hard to find these days and these guys have it!!</text>

< text>
ETA:
I appreciate the willingness to communicate to resolve the issues and send someone out the next day. We still value the work that BH does and will call again in the future. Thank you Julie.

_______________________________________________________________________

So disappointed to be writing an unfavorable review for Bill Howe. BH has been the ONLY company we have called over the past years and we generally have had excellent service.

2.5 weeks ago we called to have a drain cleared. The tech came and although I told him the problem was in the bathroom (after all, we had this service performed many times) he said that he could fix the problem from the main. He did not come inside and clear the drain, he snaked the main line. We decided at that time to have the cast iron pipes replaced under the house the following week. The tech showed up on the Monday to work (by himself after we were quoted the job with 3 people), the first day he cut through our hot water line, which necessitated a master plumber to come out and fix (while our job sat on hold). The NEXT day he hit our main line while digging, which, yet again, necessitated another master plumber to come fix, while our job sat on hold yet again.

Fast forward to today, where our bathtub drain will not drain. I called first thing in the morning to schedule a technician to come out and was given a window between 10am and 1pm. I was also told I *might* be charged for the visit. At 1:10 I called because there was no one there and we received no call. I was informed that the tech was on lunch and it would be another 40 minutes before he would be at our house. We could wait no longer so I expressed my frustration and asked to reschedule, and was given YET ANOTHER 3 hour window the next day to sit around and wait.

So BH has been to our house 3x in the past 2.5 weeks, our problem is NOT resolved, we get stood up for an appointment after waiting all day, and we are invited to KEEP WAITING. Seriously disappointed.<//text>

< Rating>
5< /Rating>
< review>
We recently experienced our water heater failing on New Year's Day at our home, not a pleasant expereince by any means. I called on that Sunday (further complicated by the fact that Monday was the observed holiday) and was contacted by Marcus Noble, a master plumber from Bill Howe.

With virtually no one open on Sunday and Monday they were able to understand our home, specify the proper tankless unit and on that Wednesday Marcus arrived and over the course of the day executed an extraordinary installation that was flawless.

He was a true professional and took the time to do every step of his craft with perfection. It was a difficult installation of Rinnai's new tankless with a built-in recirculation pump. Marcus not only was a master plumber but left no detail unanswered. While working in one area of our garage, he treated the space as if it was in the living room of our home.

I don't normally 'post' but this was a remarkable expereince and I would recommend the company and Marcus to anyone in need of this type of service.<//review>
